author: Brad Crouch
title: Tired of family drama at Christmas? Here are our tips for a fuss-free festive cruise
text:
CHRISTMAS – that beautiful time of year when families get together to celebrate and sometimes get on each other’s nerves.
Crowded houses, lots of cooking, cleaning, washing up and gift giving can ramp up stress levels before you get to collapse on the lounge to watch the Boxing Day Test and Sydney to Hobart yacht race while gnawing on leftovers, surrounded by yuletide debris.
An alternative is a cruise. It makes Christmas a holiday for all with minimum drama and maximum relaxation.
All the cooking, cleaning and washing up is taken care of – even your bed gets made – and all guests in an extended family have their own space to enjoy a genuine holiday while gathering as loving clans when they feel so inclined around the pool and at meal times.
Whether on a river cruise celebrating Christmas in the European tradition of markets, heading to the South Pacific where Santa rides a surfboard rather than a sleigh, or to other places on a floating resort, consider a cruisy Christmas.
CARNIVAL
Carnival Spirit and Carnival Legend are bringing snow to the South Pacific this Christmas, with snow in the ships’ atriums during celebrations along with Christmas trees, Santa, carolling and a special choreographed holiday show. A Christmas Eve dinner features, then a Christmas Day lunch with seafood, roast duck, lamb and turkey. Carnival Spirit will be on an eight-night New Caledonia cruise, departing Sydney on December 19, 2015, calling at Mare, Isle of Pines and Noumea. The ship will be at sea on Christmas Day. Carnival Legend will be on a 10-night Great Barrier Reef cruise, departing Sydney on December 20, 2015, calling at Airlie Beach, Yorkeys Knob (Cairns), Port Douglas (Christmas Day), Willis Island and Brisbane – move quick for this one, now priced from $1549 a person, twin share, valid until July 30, 2015.
Ph 13 31 94 or see carnival.com.au
P&O
P&O Cruises also will have snow machines as well as a visit from Santa, carols and laser show, cookie decorating, gingerbread house display, Christmas church services, a Christmas Eve concert with guest entertainers and the Passenger Christmas Choir, Christmas movies and a Christmas Eve lolly grotto with lights, lollies and chocolate fountains. Complimentary child minding (ages 3-12) will be available on Christmas evening from 10pm until 1am. Traditional Christmas Eve dinner and Christmas Day lunch will be served with all the trimmings.
Cruises include:
Pacific Eden on a 12-night roundtrip Queensland cruise, departing Sydney on
December 16, 2015, with Christmas Day at sea, priced from $1499 a person quad share;
Pacific Dawn on a nine-night roundtrip Pacific Islands cruise, departing Brisbane on December 19, 2015, with Christmas Day at Lifou, priced from $1499 a person quad share;
Pacific Pearl on a 10-night roundtrip Pacific Island cruise, departing Sydney on December 17, 2015, with Christmas Day at sea, priced from $1424 a person quad share.
Ph 13 24 94 or see pocruises.com.au
 Santa surfs on the FlowRider aboard Royal Caribbean International ship Voyager of the Seas. Source: Supplied
ROYAL CARIBBEAN
Join a surfing Santa on Royal Caribbean International Christmas cruises from Sydney and Brisbane this year. RCI celebrates the occasion with a gourmet Christmas Day meal, a meet and greet with Santa and his elves, Christmas movies, music and decorations, Christmas carolling, midnight mass, Christmas Eve story time, Christmas cookie decorating for families and Christmas arts and crafts for kids.
“Cruises are brilliant multigenerational family holidays at any time of year, and it is especially wonderful over Christmas,” company spokesman Sean Treacy says. “Imagine having a Christmas with everything taken care of – from Christmas dinner to the decorations and festive activities that also come with an ocean view. Once the stress is taken out of the equation, you are free to enjoy Christmas as it’s meant to be celebrated — creating happy memories with family and loved ones.”
RCI has an upgrade offer plus $200 on-board credit for bookings on Explorer of the Seas if booked by July 31, 2015, for a 13-night South Pacific cruise departing Sydney on December 24, 2015, priced from $3299 a person, twin share, for a balcony cabin. Other RCI Christmas cruises include 11 nights to New Zealand on Voyager of the Seas departing Sydney on December 18 priced from $2699 a person, twin share, for a balcony cabin; an 11-night South Pacific cruise on Radiance of the Seas departing Sydney on December 15 priced from $1999 for a balcony cabin.
Ph 1800 754 500 or see royalcaribbean.com.au
SCENIC
If you prefer your Christmas cruise with real snow, Scenic Tours has a dedicated Christmas Wonderland brochure which includes options to experience a European winter.
Travel to Europe for the festive lights and traditional Christmas markets which begin in late November. Sail the grand waterways on a 15-Day Christmas Markets River Cruise from Budapest to Amsterdam on November 23 and sample festive delicacies such as mulled wine and hot chestnuts, and shop for handmade gifts and decorations in the traditional markets of Vienna, Rothenberg, Nuremberg and Cologne – home to the largest Christmas tree in Germany. it’s priced at $7695 a person, twin share.
For anyone wanting to spend Christmas Day and New Year’s Eve in Europe, soak up the festive feel on a Scenic “Space-Ship” on a 16-day Christmas and New Year River Cruise from Amsterdam to Budapest, departing December 15. Celebrate Christmas Day in Linz in Austria and enjoy traditional Christmas dishes and midnight mass. Priced at $11,390 a person, twin share. Extend your stay and ring in the New Year in Prague, spend a day in this city before enjoying a celebratory dinner and entertainment as you see in 2016. Or plan ahead to do the same trip next year departing December 14, 2016, priced from $8495 a person twin share.
Ph 1300 SCENIC or see scenictours.com.au
PRINCESS
Princess Cruises will celebrate the season with holly and mistletoe, a gingerbread house challenge, carolling, religious services, traditional movies on the poolside superscreen, even a log “fire” on stateroom TVs. Santa will visit with gifts and an officer will read The Night Before Christmas . Traditional Christmas meals will be served along with seasonal sweet treats such as gingerbread mousse, mincemeat pie, chocolate Yule logs and Christmas cookies.
Dawn Princess guests will enjoy a 13-night roundtrip New Caledonia and Vanuatu cruise, departing Sydney on December 21, 2015, with Christmas Day in Vila, priced from $1999 a person, twin-share;
Golden Princess will sail on a 13-night roundtrip New Zealand cruise, departing Melbourne on December 21, 2015, with Christmas Day in Auckland, priced from $2399 a person, twin-share.
Ph 13 24 88 or see princess.com
APT
APT is celebrating Christmas in July by offering groups of family and friends the chance to cruise together with big savings on one of its festive European river cruises. Book a full price cabin and receive the second cabin half price on all Europe river cruise departures from November 26 to December 24, 2015. The offer includes APT’s 15-day Magnificent Europe White Christmas and New Year’s Eve which departs on the December 24, 2015. Priced from $8995 a person, twin share, the cruise takes guests on a journey from Budapest to Amsterdam aboard one of APT’s latest luxury riverships. Highlights include a special Christmas feast in Budapest, a New Year’s Eve dinner and celebration in Nuremberg and a visit to Melk Abbey . Offer valid until August 31, 2015.
Ph 1300 196 420, or see visit aptouring.com.au/Christmas
 Christmas market in Salzburg, Austria. Picture: Getty Source: Supplied
EVERGREEN
Evergreen Tours has deals for Christmas shopping in Europe for people who want to exchange gifts at home. Their 15-day Christmas markets cruise between Amsterdam and Budapest departs on November 28, 2015. The timing is perfect for combining a holiday with the charm of the Christmas markets, and for doing all your Christmas shopping at once before heading home. The 2015 trip is priced from $6925 a person, twin-share, while a similar departure in November, 2016, currently has a Fly Free Earlybird offer. The cruises can also be combined with extensions to Paris and Prague for a 21-day cruise tour.
Ph 1300 641 171 or evergreentours.com.au
HOLLAND AMERICA
Visit the neighbours across the Tasman this Christmas on a 16-day cruise on Holland America Line’s Noordam during its maiden season based out of Sydney. Departing Sydney on December 17 for a roundtrip sailing, this itinerary offers an extensive exploration of New Zealand including charming towns, stunning coastline and dramatic fjords and sounds. The sailing also includes an overnight call in Auckland, where guests will be able to make the most of this happening city. And being the Christmas holiday, Holland America Line will ensure that guests are well looked after, with festive meals and entertainment providing plenty of Christmas cheer. The cruise is priced from $2999 a person, twin-share.
Ph 1300 987 322 or see hollandamerica.com.au
BENTOURS
Plan ahead for next year to spend a white Christmas in Antarctica cruise on MS Fram . Departing on December 15, 2016, fly into Ushuaia from Buenos Aires and for 20 days cruise the Southern Ocean to Antarctica, the Falklands, South Georgia and South Orkneys. On board, celebrate Christmas in the traditional Norwegian way and celebrate the New Year in one of Earth’s most remote and pristine regions. Journey ashore to isolated beaches, hike volcanoes, kayak through virgin waters with icebergs floating by and encounter unique wildlife. The Norwegian crew celebrate Christmas with a range of Norwegian dishes and mulled wine, Santa will visit and carols will be sung. From $15,552 a person, twin-share.
Ph 1800 221 712 or see bentours.com.au
